intro: Tetramolopium filiforme, commonly known as the slender tetramolopium, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Its filiform (thread-like) stems and narrow leaves are adapted to reduce water loss in arid conditions. Tetramolopium filiforme is an important component of local ecosystems, providing food and habitat for various insects and small animals.
